Reviews.Title: 12Volt Security Camera Power Supply
Reviews.Author: Kyle 07
Reviews.Content: Power supply does save space by being able to power 4 cameras but fails at doing it well, I only currently have 3 cameras and it struggles with them, none of my cameras are very power hungry only 2 have ir illumination and thats where the problem is ,when it gets dark i get interferance on the cameras that wasnt there during the day or when they were powered by separate power supplies.I will have to relace this with a beefier power supply now since i have a 4th camera in the box that I dont want to cause more problems with.

Reviews.Title: Seems to do the trick
Reviews.Author: A. Ferdinand
Reviews.Content: Just like the preivous reviewer, I was also a bit concerned but went ahead with the purchase. When I got the unit, I checked voltage and polarity at all of the plugs, and everything seemed to be in order so I went ahead.  It seems to work just fine for me, powering (at present) two 250 mA  IR cameras with no issues.I really like the fact that the transformer has a normal power cord and is not a "wall wart" style, as it saves room on outlets.

Reviews.Title: Working perfectly fine for about a month now.
Reviews.Author: S. Simmons
Reviews.Content: I have been using this product to power 3 cameras (one plug unused) and this product is working as i expected.  Although I was concerned by the previous review, this was the only choice for a 4-way, so I tried it out.  It does have a higher total output than the adaptor that came with my nightowl dvr's cameras, but the voltage is the same 12v.  Always check your camera specs before choosing a transformer.  Some cameras (some PTZ Cameras for example) need 24v, but they often have the transformer included with camera.  Voltage has to be the same on each camera and transformer, but Amps rating of the transformer needs to be equal to or higher than the total amps required by all the cameras you intend to hook up to the transformer.  One last thing, this product doesn't have a UL logo if that bothers you, however it does have the european CE logo.  I believe the previous unfortunate reviewer had some other problem occur as a coincidence when his equipment failed.

Reviews.Title: very nice!  Good regulated power supply!
Reviews.Author: dincon2000
Reviews.Content: As soon as this came in I pulled all the wall-worts out of the power strip and plugged this in. Plugged in the cameras and Boom! done.

Reviews.Title: Quality product
Reviews.Author: Richard G. Evansii "Onlybygrace1"
Reviews.Content: Running 3 cameras from this unit. Connectors well made, cords perfect length to mount next to DVR. No complaints here. I would gladly buy another if I needed one.

Reviews.Title: Good for a 4 camera setup
Reviews.Author: BrianHelp
Reviews.Content: This is good for a 4 camera setup. Keeping the wires neatly especially if you are running cat5 to each camera for power and for video feed.  Reliable power supply.

Reviews.Title: awesome pc.
Reviews.Author: Nowin M.
Reviews.Content: Works real good, have more space due the fact is only one plug .. would recommend to others.  Works very well

Reviews.Title: Works for LED strips
Reviews.Author: D. Francey "MtnXf"
Reviews.Content: I bought this and a pack of female 5.5mm tips to use for light strips above my cabinets.  Its been working for several months without issues so far being on everyday for 4+ hours.

Reviews.Title: Very Cheap
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: This device gets really hot, and when it does it cuts off. I was  powering ONE camera that was rated at <750 mA with around 10ft of cat5 cable and it still struggled.

Reviews.Title: Works without any problems
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: Product arrived within a weeks from ordering. Like described, it works with my camera fine, plug and play. The cord is a bit short but for me it is enough. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great product!
Reviews.Author: Sabrina M.
Reviews.Content: As soon as my security system cameras went out I thought I will have to purchase a new one. However my husband suggested we should try the charger first even if we would have wasted some money in case it did not work. When it came the charger fit right in with the system and all my cameras started working. I am very pleased. I will recommend purchasing a charger first if you have issues with your security cameras.

Reviews.Title: STOPPED WORKING AFTER 2 MONTHS
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these for a new Swann 4ch DVR CCTV system. I added two more cameras to the system, and needed a four camera power supply. I install CCTV systems and figured I could try a different supplier this time. Under normal use, it quit on two channels and made the other cameras look fuzzy, which meant it was no longer suppling the proper voltage to the cameras. I'm just glad this piece of crap died instead of the DVR. *SUMMARY*  Keep looking and don't order from this supplier. -Cheap Product-. I tried contacting supplier ( VideoSecu ) with no response. Their loss, as I could have given them alot of buisness through my work. Unless the supplier contacts me to resolve this, it will stay at one star.

Reviews.Title: Beware: some are 1A not the 2A advertized
Reviews.Author: B. Turner "Quigath"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for an LED lighting project for the kitchen. I needed a power supply with 2 amps of power but most being sold are less expensive and just provide 1 amp. I was happy to find this one being sold at a good price and rated at 2 amps, so I got it. When delivered though, I was disappointed to see the rating on the plug said it was only 1 amp. I didn't test it myself - pulling more power than rated can cause it to overheat. The power supplies have been returned and my money refunded. I am now looking for a true 2A power supply for my project.Maybe there was a temporary problem with the manufacturer or something, just be sure to carefully inspect what is delivered to you. The plug should be rated at 2 amp.Also, I noticed that the 4-to-1 plug converter was a separate octopus-type wire splitter that plugged into the main power supply. It's not exactly how the picture looks. A single wire comes out of the supply and ends in a 2.1mm male plug. The splitter can then be attached. FYIThis power plug would have been perfect had it been what was advertized. Guess it really was too good of a deal to be real.

Reviews.Title: I was happy
Reviews.Author: Andtos
Reviews.Content: It worked out of the box but only for a month, very disappointed . I used this thing to power two cameras and I don't know what happen that it stopped working, the day it stopped working was raining with a lot of lightning .

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: alexander lavin
Reviews.Content: i am using this power supply for a while,no complaint so far,i will recommend this to anyone who look for one like this

Reviews.Title: As advertised.
Reviews.Author: tlong927
Reviews.Content: I added 4 additional cameras to my system. I need more power. Hooked this bad boy up and it worked perfectly. I will post an update if the power supply fails.

Reviews.Title: This power supply works fine to power our video camera.

Reviews.Content: This power supply works fine to power our video camera. It has not failed and this is the third place we use this type of power supply in our hall. They work and are cost effective.

Reviews.Title: As advertised...

Reviews.Content: Not the highest quality item in feel.... But, it powers my cameras with no problem and was a good price... So no complaints,

Reviews.Title: power supply adapter

Reviews.Content: item was sent on time .i have no complaints.nice price,hooked  up to four camras and they work fine.for the price a very good item.

Reviews.Title: Double Whammy
Reviews.Author: Danny U.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this power supply to clean up the mess I had with four separate power supplies for my cameras. After installing it I realized my picture was so much clearer on my phone and my computer. I always had goofy lines and some blurry spots intermittently when I was viewing the cameras. I thought it was because I bought inexpensive cameras. Not the case. This power supply makes it look like I have all new stuff! I recommend this to anyone who is having wierd things going on when viewing your cameras or if you just want to clean up the mess that individual power supplies make.

Reviews.Title: works great

Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Content: I find no problems with this item..it works very well for me, and each camera is at least 50' away from the DVR.  I detectvery little voltage drop.Yes..I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Content: this videosecu  is worth buying it works just as good as if you buy one of 100 dollars  I would recommend this

Reviews.Content: VideoSecu 12V DC CCTV Security Camera Power Supply Adapter with 4 (2.1mm)Works to power my other cameras on by swann system.

Reviews.Title: As promised

Reviews.Title: frustrating lines..
Reviews.Author: L. Sarver "awaken812"
Reviews.Content: I bought this adapter because it was recommended that I use a 12V..my old camera was not that powerful..but this new one is an amazing camera except for the adapter, it didn't come with one. Amazon had this adapter right next to the camera as a great choice for the camera. At night which is when I really need to record I get nothing but black lines up and down and a patch of color static across the screen. I have captured great stuff but hard to see with the lines moving up and down across the screen. I read from different sources that it could be the adapter. I am now in the process of ordering RG59 Siamese cable which is very expensive or ordering another 12V which has great reviews from customers who have the same experience as me. I will another 12V  first if it doesn't work then I will buy the RG59 Siamese cable and will update the results.Bottom line if you have a good camera powerful like mine I would not recommend this.UPDATE: Today may 24 i received the new adapter OMG is amazing..all this time trying to figure out if it was cables or camera ..slowly and gradually narrowed down to the adapter...but today when I received the new adapter and remove this one they sell Voila! no lines great clear picture ...night vision is amazing..just to be fair my camera is powerful though it was only $70 I got it from Amazon because of the reviews ..the best camera!!! but it needed a powerful adapter..here is the adapter i received today in case someone is suffering like I was ,..and it was less money than this one here..just $10 I am going to order more VideoSecu 12V DC 2A 2000mA 100V - 240V AC Regulated Power Supply Adaptor for CCTV Security Camera Home Surveillance System PW2000R 1LCgood luck for those of you Night Vision aficionados

But I find that most of the system struggle with only 2A power supply when using extensions.Q-See OEM -- if you are reading this, I like your product over all, but I would happily pay $1 more if you could bump this up to 3 or 4 or even a 5A supply.Also to note (that I will post in another review), the IR LED's in the cameras are just a tad bit too far into the visible spectrum. I'd rather my sites don't see the red glow coming from the cameras and just have a bit more of the invisible spectrum used.

Now if your like me and bought this before they started sending them out i would definatly buy this. This device has helped me out greatly and i see no difference in the picture or quality. Great little thing if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: Works great and its the right price

These cleaned up the mess of wires I had going on without the need to purchase and install a power distribution cabinet.  They provide the clean power I needed and so far have worked quite well.  There is very little noise and the power appears to be quite clean.This has been a great value so far.

Reviews.Title: Power adapter  as advertised !
Reviews.Author: Bear402 "bear402"
Reviews.Content: Item arrived quickly . Power supply will run up to 4 cameras, depending on  individual camera power requirements. Customer service and satisfaction is obviously a priority at Electrodisc. !

Reviews.Title: Cheap junk, not UL listed, improper labeling, I won't trust it to run unattended
Reviews.Author: A.
Reviews.Content: This power-supply is a cheap knock-off. It does not have proper labeling like most power-supplies sold in the USA (e.g. it does not say what Class powers supply it is, class 2 or class 3 or whatever)  and it is not UL listed. the top cover is loose and feels cheap. This may be nit-picking but consider this: for home security applications this device is going to be plugged-in all the time,  unattended in a cabinet somewhere. Exactly the kind of situation where you cannot afford to have a melt-down or overheat or worse. There's a reason we want UL listed power supplies, for safety.

Reviews.Title: Works very well
Reviews.Author: Kamran
Reviews.Content: This plug saved me from buying a outlet strip.  My cameras are working well. I would buy this item again. At a fraction of the cost of four plugs it,s the best deal.

Reviews.Title: will fry cams...under powered
Reviews.Author: B. Moon
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great idea so I got it.  It promptly fried 2 cams as I was plugging them in. This power supply (PS) puts all the voltage to a single outlet when plugged in, then divides accordingly per camera, in other words, it doesn't regulate the outputs.  Had I plugged in all 4 cams THEN plugged the PS into the 120 volt outlet, I thinks things would have been okay.  A (PS) unit like this should have its power outputs isolated and regulated, period! Units of higher quality will typically do this.  I have many guitar pedals that run off of a single 9 VDC (PS) similar to this one that do in fact isolate and regulate the way it should be done and I've never had an issue using one or two of 8 or so outputs on pedal costing $100's, some of which are connected to PC based recording equipment. Regardless, when all 4 cams are plugged in, the two 100' (16GA solid copper wires) runs are grossly under powered resulting in poor image quality and the IR will not work at night causing the those cams to go offline unless there is a light source in the field of view of the cam.  With individual PS's, this has simply never been an issue for the past 3 years, (I got this 4 in 1 unit to save outlet space).  Last night, 3 of the 4 cams went offline for no apparent reason and an acrid smell of burning electronics was emanating from the dedicated PC that hosts the cams.  Now I have NO security system and a lot of money up in smoke.  For sure, the DVR is toast and until I can get my system back online, I will not know if the cams survived this. This $19 PS (POS!!) may have just cost me a $1,000 in fried equipment!  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! Buyer beware!Update 01/04/2012:  Someone commented that it is impossible for the host PC to have been damaged by back-feeding current.  While I agree it is highly unlikely and I'm no electrical engineer, but this setup did in fact fry the USB circuits on the motherboard rendering the $1,800 PC useless until costly MoBo is replaced. I have since done away with that entire configuration and went with a dedicated Linux based 4 port CCTV DVR purchased from Amazon and went back to 4 individual power supplies and have not had one second of down time in the past year.  As for the "old" PC, it's collecting dust in the garage!

Reviews.Title: not working for my new camera system
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: I have an old video camera, and need these to convert to my new digital camera, I connected these to my new system and not working at all, not sure why

Reviews.Title: The out put wired connections are too short.
Reviews.Author: Rodney A. Watson "rawdawgy"
Reviews.Content: The lead from the output is less than 24" long and the leads are less than 6" long so you have to put the power supply on the shelf with the DVR instead of on the floor. Some one screwed up by trying to save 5 cents and not adding 6" of lead wire to the output length.

Reviews.Title: My dog loves it. You believe that me tell you another
Reviews.Author: redbmw4545
Reviews.Content: I needed a muzzle to keep my dog from biting self, especially his tail. Come to find out he has an allergic reaction to the dog food. We were feed him. We took him to the vet. They appreciated the muzzle because he does not like people touching his tail. Can't blame him. I don't want no one touching my tale. Either. Ha ha

Reviews.Title: It's soo nice getting rid of all those wall warts
Reviews.Author: Rich B "Richb1228"
Reviews.Content: Very nice power supply this really cleans up a camera installation all u need is one outlet to power 4 cameras highly recommended

Reviews.Title: WORKS
Reviews.Author: patel123
Reviews.Content: this product does what it says, these are way better then the original cctv power boxes. i had to replace the old box with these

Reviews.Title: So far so good...
Reviews.Author: RandyO
Reviews.Content: Running a full compliment of devices (4 cameras, had to use additional for DVR)..I did give 5 stars but it could use a couple tweaks..There are only 4 leads on this thing... DVR plus 4 channels = 5 leads needed.  Still stuck using 2 outlets and if you are on battery backup? well two transformers are a PITA..I think it would be a nice touch to make the leads removable (would allow for different lengths too)

Reviews.Title: It's a Prank if you buy this
Reviews.Author: Houdini Jr
Reviews.Content: The tin can was worth more than contents. Good routines in book but product cheap stuff. As a kid I liked SSAdams much better.

Reviews.Title: Fuente de alimentación para cámaras de seguridad
Reviews.Author: Wilson Sanchez
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto!!!Tengo un sistema Q-See QR414 4 Channel Network DVR, sistema de 4 cámaras de seguridad y vigilancia para mi casa, muy buen dispositivo, pero el problema con las cámaras es que requería un adaptador de poder para cada una. Este adaptador suministra corriente a las 4 cámaras al mismo tiempo. Además del ahorro de energía, solo necesito un conector.Lo recomiendo!!!

ProductInfo.Features:
12V DC Regulated CCTV Power Supply
Four 2.1mm DC Output Center Positive
4 Camera Power Supply 2 Amp Total Output
Simplifying the Installation Process
Eliminates the Bulky Wall Mounted Power Supplies
ProductInfo.Name: VideoSecu 12V DC CCTV Security Camera Power Supply Adapter with 4 (2.1mm) Channel Connectors Port PW154 1I0
